result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy S. Beck Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--With Huber/work-release privileges

--This jail sentence may be transferred to Waukesha Co., so long as it is served in the same way that the sentence would be served in Jefferson Co., without any type of electronic monitoring and at no additional cost to Jefferson Co. 

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 2 letters written on the defendant's behalf submitted by Attorney Wolff at sentencing
Order for the Destruction of Firearm
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 8:13am [mo]
Defendant Timothy S. Beck in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Wolff submits 2 letters written on behalf on Mr. Beck 

Statement made by Mr. Beck

On Count #1 and Count #2 WITHOUT the 'Dangerous Weapon' enhancer, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--On Count #1: to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, to commence on     9/14/15 at  6:00pm.
--This jail sentence may be transferred to Waukesha Co., so long as it is served in the same way that the sentence would be served in Jefferson Co., without any type of electronic monitoring and at no additional cost to Jefferson Co. 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--no contact with the victim
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

ADA Shock submits a proposed order for destruction of the firearm used in the connection with this crime
--The Court signs this as its order

The Court denies Mr. Beck the opportunity to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation 

Days credit for time already served:  1  days
recess: 8:50am
Sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 08:10 am
Scheduling Notice
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:38pm [mo]
Defendant Timothy S. Beck Jr. in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses the Dangerous Weapons enhancer on Count #2
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2 (without the dangerous weapons enhancer); factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


Atty. Wolff requests that Sentencing occur out 45 days to allow additional treatment and assessments
--No objection from ADA Teuber

recess: 2:50pm

NEXT: Sentencing: 9/1/2015 at 8:10am
for continuance is granted
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-20-2015 02:30 pm
Proposed stip and order to adjourn
Letter from Attorney Wolff re scheduling
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-20-2015 09:30 am
Scheduling Notice

[MK] case called at 9:51am. 
Defendant Timothy S. Beck in court with Attorney Hoff (for Attorney Peter Wolff who is now representing Mr. Beck).  ADA  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hoff indicates that case discussions continue, however the case can be scheduled for projected plea and sentencing hearing at this point. 
recess 9:53am. 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing hearing on July 20th at 9:30am.
State's with cover letter
Defendants
Demand for jury trial submitted by Attorney Wolff
Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2015 at 08:20 am.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 1:23-pm. 
[Commissioner Fremgen presiding for Intake]
Defendant Timothy S. Beck appears in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (For bond purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney De La Rosa indicates the PD Office will represent Mr. Beck for bond purposes only
Right to Counsel given
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 

The Court requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of firearms
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence at bars, taverns, liquor stores, or places where the primary purpose is the service of alcohol
--no contact with Daniel Sutton or Lindsay Chadwick
recess 1:32  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference: May 6, 2015 at 8:20am   (2) Status Conference: June 9, 2015 at 10:00am
